trial_identification.studytitle: Do discharge plans meet patients requirements and expectations? An observational study.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Do the discharge plans for patients undergoing rehabilitation match their requirements and expectations?

interventions.interventions: Usual rehabilitation (both in-patient and, if required, out-patient) will not change as a result of this study. This includes comprehensive discharge planning by the multidisciplinary team. Follow-up will occur 1-2 months after discharge from the rehabilitation facility.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Telephone interview to examine whether discharge plans meet patients requirements and expectations.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: All patients discharged home from the Stroke or Specialist Rehabilitation Units at Hampstead Rehabilitation Centre or St Margaret's Rehabilitation Hospital.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Inability to communicate effectively in English. Refuse consent.

trial_design.statisticalmethods: In order to obtain a representative sample a total of at least 20 participants from each site will be sought. Analyses will be predominantly descriptive in nature.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this observational study is to investigate whether discharge plans for patients undergoing rehabilitation that are put in place prior to patients discharge actually meet patients requirements and expectations following discharge.
